snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio said 23 of devices are in use, and officials hope that by next year 140 will be operational.
abstract: New York Mayor Bill de Blasio says city has begun deploying traffic cameras equipped with radar near schools where speeding has been problematic; 2014 law allows city to add 120 cameras to 20 it had already begun installing; use of speed cameras is also approved around schools on Long Island.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio said 23 of devices are in use, and officials hope that by next year 140 will be operational.

headline.main: New York Installs Speed Cameras Near Schools
headline.print_headline: City Installs Speed Cameras Near Schools
